intro: Ulmaria vestita, commonly known as small white clover, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and small white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. It has a shallow root system and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment. Ulmaria vestita is also valued for its use in herbal medicine and as a forage crop for livestock.
